attributes.action: abolish plans to introduce permanent 2% rise in fuel duty
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The chancellor has decided to offset the TEMPORARY lowering of VAT by raising the fuel duty by the same amount:
"So I will offset the VAT reduction, by increasing all these duties by an amount which should keep the overall cost to consumers the same this year."
- A. Darling

The interesting phrase is "this year". Following years, when the VAT rate is returned to 17.5%, the additional fuel duty will not be removed, so we will be paying increased fuel taxes.

This is a tax on going to work, something all working people have to do, whether by personal transport or public transport, much of which also runs on diesel.

Again the government is imposing unfair taxes on those who work for a living; taxes which again target working classes and lower middle classes who have the same need to commute but lower incomes.

We do not need taxes to be raised on WORKING.
